title: Cell3™ Target Cell Free DNA Target Enrichment for NGS Part 8: Captured Library Amplification and Clean-up
author: Opentrons
description:
Links:
 Part 1: Fragmentation / End-repair / A-tailing
 Part 2: Ligation of Illumina UMI adapters
 Part 3: Clean-up of adapter ligated library
 Part 4: Library Amplification
 Part 5: Library Pooling
 Part 6: Probe Hybridization
 Part 7: Probe Capture on Streptavidin Beads and Washes
 Part 8: Captured Library Amplification and Clean-up
---
This protocol performs the workflow of Cell Free DNA Target Enrichment as described in the NONACUS Cell3™ Target Protocol Guide v1.2.2. This particular section is part 8 of the series, products of part 7 are amplified by PCR using primers that specifically bind to the P5-P7 sequences on Illumina adapters. Target Pure™ NGS clean-up beads are then used to clean-up the amplified captured library.
Before you start, review the protocol guide to confirm kit contents and make sure you have the required equipment and consumables. Follow the instructions to set up the appropriate thermocycler program. See 'Additional Notes' below for reagent setup.
This marks the end of the automation portion of this protocol. If you are not proceeding immediately to the library quality check step, store the captured DNA library at -20°C.
---

Opentrons P300 Single-channel Pipette
Opentrons 300 uL Tipracks
Biorad Hard-Shell 96-well PCR Plates
Opentrons Temperature Module
Opentrons Magnetic Module
Cell3™ Target: Library Preparation kit
